intro: Clibadium barbasco, commonly known as the arrowhead vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant is notable for its toxic seeds, which contain the potent hallucinogen 5-MeO-DMT. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical features make it both an ecological and ethnobotanical subject of interest.
